meanings.definition: Excessively strict or precise in matters of morality or conduct.
meanings.sent1: The overscrupulous teacher always checked every student's homework with a magnifying glass.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her overscrupulous attention to detail when it came to following rules.
meanings.sent3: The overscrupulous referee insisted on measuring the soccer field with a ruler before the game.
meanings.sent4: His overscrupulous nature made him the perfect candidate for the job of quality control inspector.
meanings.sent5: The overscrupulous detective never missed a single clue at the crime scene.

meanings.definition: Showing excessive concern for what is right or proper.
meanings.sent1: The overscrupulous student always raised his hand to ask if the assignment was fair to everyone.
meanings.sent2: She was overscrupulous about returning borrowed items promptly to their owners.
meanings.sent3: The overscrupulous chef refused to use any ingredients past their expiration date.
meanings.sent4: His overscrupulous behavior in the office earned him the reputation of being a stickler for the rules.
meanings.sent5: The overscrupulous driver never exceeded the speed limit, even when running late.
